doc.after: The UK's de facto official language is English.[321][322] It is estimated that 95% of the UK's population are monolingual English speakers.[323] 5.5% of the population are estimated to speak languages brought to the UK as a result of relatively recent immigration.[323] South Asian languages, including Bengali, Tamil, Punjabi, Hindi and Gujarati, are the largest grouping and are spoken by 2.7% of the UK population.[323] According to the 2011 census, Polish has become the second-largest language spoken in England and has 546,000 speakers.[324]
